findings.rationale: The three-year term may expose the parties to risks of unauthorized use of confidential information after the agreement expires.
findings.evidence_quote: This Agreement shall remain in effect for three (3) years from the date of execution, after which the obligations shall terminate.

findings.rationale: The broad definition of Confidential Information may lead to disputes over what constitutes confidential data, creating potential for misuse.
findings.evidence_quote: Confidential Information includes all proprietary information, trade secrets, business plans, financial data, and technical information disclosed by either party.

findings.rationale: While the contract mentions returning or destroying confidential information, it may lack clarity on enforcement or consequences for non-compliance.
findings.evidence_quote: Upon termination, each party shall return or destroy all Confidential Information received from the other party.
